stimulusHtml: Two identical spaceships are moving through space both with speed v0. Both spaceships experience a net force of magnitude F0 over the same time interval. For spaceship 1, the net force acts in the same direction as the spaceship is moving; for spaceship 2, the net force is directed opposite to the spaceshipâ€™s motion, causing spaceship 2 to slow down but not stop. For which spaceship, if either, does the kinetic energy change by a greater magnitude, and why?
choicesHtml: Spaceship 1 will have a greater change in kinetic energy because the distance traveled is greater than that of spaceship 2.
Spaceship 2 will have a greater change in kinetic energy because the force slows down the spaceship.
Spaceship 1 and 2 have the same change in kinetic energy because the time and the force are the same.
Spaceship 1 and 2 have the same change in kinetic energy because the net work done on each has the same magnitude.
